data.text:
@RogerPielkeJr @Ayjchan Can anyone explain how natural origin is possible given no animals tested (0/80000) were infected with this highly infectious virus, whilst the CCP was trying to prove market origin?

How come the virus is twice as infectious to humans as civets etc, and doesn't infect bats?

@gdemaneuf @lab_leak @emmecola @acritschristoph @Ayjchan @alchemytoday @RogerPielkeJr From what I understood from the preprint they tested the robustness, but based on the initial dataset, basically just added noise. I don’t think it’s enough at all considering the biases of the initial sample

@RogerPielkeJr @mattwridley @Ayjchan Oh, come on,  surely you can do better than that.

Maybe you can recruit another "expert", like, say, John Lott?
@emmecola @acritschristoph @Ayjchan @alchemytoday @RogerPielkeJr If they had chosena different title all would be well, e.g. "Huanan market emerges as point of origin due to data ascertainment bias."
@IsabellWelpe @emmecola @acritschristoph @Ayjchan @alchemytoday @RogerPielkeJr In other news, water is wet.
